content: Robo-Advisors Investments Autowealth Stashaway Coffee Meets Investing Asked by AnonymousAsked on 07 Jul 2018StashAway recently mentioned that they plan to claim back the withholding dividend tax by US. Does AutoWealth intend to do the same?2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Amanda OngLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi!​Just to share, we have just reimbursed the witholding tax refund last week to all clients who are entitled to it for the FY2017. ​If you received a reimbursement, you would have received an email from us informing you of this :)3 comments3

See all 3 comments Christopher How08 Oct 2018Thanks Amanda. Are you able to provide more clarity about the reimbursed witholding tax refund?

Is this refund for the exemption from withholding tax from bond payments that SAXO is doing for all their clients (including robo advisors like Stashaway and Autowealth) is not unique to Stashaway? I mean, I've just received the withholding tax refund for my Autowealth account as well.
... (more)Amanda Ong17 Oct 2018Hi Christopher, thank you for your question. Yes, I believe Saxo has done this for all their clients. 

I am unable to comment on their arrangement with other robo-advisors but for us, Saxo submits the application to the U.S tax authorities to claim back the withholding tax for ETFs that qualify under the QII (qualified interest income) rule. They do this once a year and once the funds are transferred to us, we will proceed to refund it to ... (more)

Tai Zhi, Chief Investment Officer at AutowealthLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 04 Mar 2019AutoWealth works with our partnering custodian to seek partial reimbursement of the withholding taxes from the U.S. Internal Revenue Service, where applicable.The lastest reimbursement for withholding taxes were credited to our clients on 26 Sep 2018.0 comments1
